incident_updates.body: We have continued to see good results over the last several hours and are now marking this issue as resolved.
We have seen a reduction in authentication errors over the last ~60 minutes but we are continuing to monitor traffic to ensure continued good performance.

We are continuing to investigate the cause of the increased authentication errors but this issue is only affecting a small number of requests relatative to our overall traffic. We are continuing to see over a 99.9% success rate for requests to our APIs.

We are currently investigating an increase in authentication errors. These errors typically include the following error message: `Authentication error, API token missing/invalid`

If you get this error please retry the request as retries are typically successful.
This incident has been resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
Our transcription processing times have returned to normal. We are still monitoring the situation.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.

We experienced slower turnaround times due to lost capacity with our hosting provider. We have scaled resources back up to help mitigate this. 

We have now worked through the backlog of processing jobs, and our team is continuing to monitor the situation.

incidents.name: Dashboard information not updating as expected

incident_updates.body: This issue has been resolved and all dashboard information is now properly updating.

Usage data is once again starting to flow through the system, but the information backlog will take time to be completely processed. The current estimate is that it will take 1-1.5 hours to process this backlog. We will provide another update once all information has been processed.
Our billing provider has identified the root cause of this issue and is working to resolve it.

We are currently working with our billing provider to address an issue that is causing certain dashboard information to not be updated as expected. This issue includes usage charts, spend charts, and balance info not reflecting current values. This issue should have no impact on API usage.

On Tuesday, February 25th from 1:01 AM to 1:08 AM Eastern Time, our service experienced a brief disruption during a routine database maintenance. During this 7-minute window, some API requests returned 500 errors, while other transcription requests were temporarily delayed in our processing queue. Any transcripts successfully queued were automatically retried and processed by our systems. Our team quickly identified the issue, reverted the changes, and fully restored service functionality by 1:08 AM. We continue to actively monitor our Async API to ensure everything is operating normally.
We have continued to see good performance and previously affected users are reporting that the issues are resolved on their end as well so we are marking this issue as resolved.
We have released a fix aimed to address the account issues we have been experiencing and are monitoring to ensure that the issue has been resolved.

We are currently investigating an issue that is causing account information to not update correctly. This can affect some of the information displayed in the dashboard including account balance, which in some edge cases involving recent payments can affect API usage.

On January 3th, 2025 and on January 8th, 2025, we experienced two incidents that resulted in service disruptions and performance degradation for our asynchronous API.

**Root Cause Analysis**  
Increased demand for the AssemblyAI asynchronous API has required changes to our datastore infrastructure to maintain performance and reliability.

* **January 3th:** Transcription Record Service system did not scale out aggressively enough to properly service the traffic. We identified a misconfiguration in the scaling policies that constrained the service’s ability to scale out. This resulted in degraded performance for and high latency time for all requests during the 1 hour window.
* **January 8th:** Our team deployed a configuration update to our infrastructure that unexpectedly caused a redeployment of the transcription record service. This resulted in failures for all customer requests during the 20-minute window while the transcription record service was redeployed and scaled back out to handle current traffic.

While both of these incidents impacted the same service, the underlying cause of each incident was different.

**Resolution and Next Steps**  
To prevent similar incidents in the future, we have:

* Adjusted the auto-scaling rules of the Transcription Record Service to scale more aggressively with additional performance metrics
* Implemented additional pre-deployment validation checks on infrastructure code changes
* Strengthening our infrastructure configuration management processes
* Improving the communication cadence to the [status page](https://status.assemblyai.com/) throughout the incident lifecycle

**Customer Commitment**  
We apologize for any inconvenience or disruption these incidents may have caused. We are committed to providing a reliable and high-performing service and are taking steps to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future. As always, you can rely on the [status page](https://status.assemblyai.com/) for up to date API information on our current status and health.
Resolving issue.
We have continued to see good performance and are now marking this issue as resolved.
We are continuing to monitor for any further issues.
The async API is continuing to serve traffic as expected and we're still actively monitoring closely.

The async API is recovered and we are serving traffic as expected. Throttled requests have been successfully processed and we will continue to monitor closely. We will provide further updates as we continue to investigate the root cause.

We have identified the issue and our team is actively working on solutions to process throttled requests. We are now seeing an increase in successful requests, but still experiencing longer than usual processing times.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are actively investigating an issue that is causing transcriptions to fail to complete. We will share further details as soon as we have more information.

**Root Cause Analysis**  
Increased demand for the AssemblyAI asynchronous API has required changes to our datastore infrastructure to maintain performance and reliability.

* **January 3th:** Transcription Record Service system did not scale out aggressively enough to properly service the traffic. We identified a misconfiguration in the scaling policies that constrained the service’s ability to scale out. This resulted in degraded performance for and high latency time for all requests during the 1 hour window.
* **January 8th:** Our team deployed a configuration update to our infrastructure that unexpectedly caused a redeployment of the transcription record service. This resulted in failures for all customer requests during the 20-minute window while the transcription record service was redeployed and scaled back out to handle current traffic.

While both of these incidents impacted the same service, the underlying cause of each incident was different.

**Resolution and Next Steps**  
To prevent similar incidents in the future, we have:

* Implemented additional pre-deployment validation checks on infrastructure code changes
* Strengthening our infrastructure configuration management processes
* Improving the communication cadence to the [status page](https://status.assemblyai.com/) throughout the incident lifecycle

As always, you can rely on the [status page](https://status.assemblyai.com/) for up to date API information on our current status and health.

incidents.name: Slower than normal processing times for our Async endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have continued to see processing times remain in the expected range and this issue is now being marked as resolved.

We have identified the root cause of the slowdown, which was a brief delay in how quickly additional AWS instances came online to support an increase in traffic. Processing times have returned to normal and we are monitoring traffic to ensure continued good performance.

We are currently seeing slower-than-normal turnaround times for our Async API. Our Engineering team is actively working on the issue. We will keep you posted as we work to get processing times back to normal.

We are once again seeing normal processing times for our Async `/v2/transcript` endpoint. We will continue to monitor traffic going forward to ensure continued good performance but at this point, the issue with AWS and limited GPU capacity affecting our traffic has been resolved.

We have been able to get increased GPU capacity from AWS as they continue to work to address the GPU capacity issues they are experiencing. We have also deployed some of our models onto other hardware and are now seeing improvements with processing times going down. We will continue to monitor this improvement and provide additional updates once we have returned to normal processing times.

We are continuing to stay in contact with AWS while they work to address the GPU capacity issues they are experiencing, which is the root cause of the slowdown we are experiencing. Our Engineering team is also working in parallel to deploy our models on other hardware to improve performance while AWS works to resolve the GPU shortage issues. We will continue to provide updates as this work continues.

We are still working to resolve the issue that is causing slower-than-usual processing times, which has led to some requests being throttled but we have identified that this slowdown is caused by an AWS GPU capacity issue in US-WEST-2. Our Engineering team is in communication with AWS support so that we can work to get this slowdown resolved as quickly as possible. We will continue to provide updates as soon as we learn more.
Our team is still working with AWS to identify the root cause of the issue causing a slowdown in processing times.

Investigating - AWS is experiencing a server issue which is negatively impacting the processing time of our Async API. This may also lead to some increased throttling. Our team is currently investigating the issue.
AWS is experiencing a server issue which is negatively impacting the processing time of our Async API. This may also lead to some increased throttling. Our team is currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Investigating an increase in 500 errors for LeMUR

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
The transient errors that were affecting LeMUR have now been resolved and regular service has been restored. We are closely monitoring recovery to ensure continued good performance.

We are continuing to work to address the issues that are causing transient errors every ~10 minutes. The majority of LeMUR requests are still completing successfully so if you do experience a failed request and a 500 error we suggest retrying the request as it will likely be successful. We will continue to provide additional updates as we learn more.

We are still working to resolve the issue causing the transient spike of errors every 10 minutes that is affecting some LeMUR requests. A potential fix was deployed but it did not resolve the issue so we are continuing to investigate. We will continue to keep you updated as we learn more.

We are still investigating issues affecting LeMUR. These issues are causing transient error spikes which seem to be occurring at 10-minute intervals. We will continue to provide updates here as we get more information from them.

We are still working to identify the root cause of the issue causing the increase in 500 errors but we are still seeing the large majority of requests to LeMUR completing successfully. We will continue to provide updates here as we learn more.

We are currently investigating an increase in the number of 500 errors we are seeing returned from LeMUR. The vast majority of LeMUR requests are still completing successfully but we are working to investigate the higher-than-usual 500 errors. We will share additional updates here as we learn more.

incidents.name: Increased 500 errors with our Async endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have continued to see good performance and no further issues since our rollback to address the issues that were affecting the Async endpoint so we are now marking this issue as resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have identified the root cause of these 500 errors with our Async endpoint to be a recent configuration change that was made. We have rolled back that change and are no longer seeing these increased 500 errors. Traffic is once again processing normally but we will continue to monitor the situation to ensure continued good performance.

We are currently investigating an issue with our Async `/v2/transcript` endpoint. This issue is currently causing about 1% of requests to that endpoint to fail with a 500 error. We are working to identify the root cause and will provide additional updates as we learn more.

incidents.name: Degradation in service for the LeMUR /lemur/v3 endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have deployed a fix to address the unexpected increase in 5xx errors that we were seeing. This fix has eliminated the unexpected errors and the issue has now been resolved.
We have identified the root cause of the issue affecting some LeMUR requests and are currently working to deploy a fix.

We are continuing to investigate the issues resulting in higher-than-normal 5xx errors for our LeMUR endpoints. While there is an increase in 5xx errors, the majority of requests using LeMUR are still completing normally. We will continue to share updates here as we learn more.
We are currently investigating an issue that is causing some requests to the `/lemur/v3` endpoint to fail with a 5xx error. We will post additional updates here as we learn more.

Our team has identified the root cause of the issues that were affecting Real-Time earlier and have deployed a fix to address them. Users are once again able to initiate Real-Time sessions using temporary tokens and the FinalTranscript text will now contain the expected punctuation.

We are continuing to work on a fix for the original issue of not being able to initiate a Real-Time session when using temporary API tokens but we have also discovered another issue that is causing the FinalTranscript to not contain the proper punctuation. Our team is working to address this issue as well.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
We have identified an issue with our Real-Time transcription service that is preventing users who are using temporary API tokens from being able to initiate a Real-Time session.

incidents.name: Increase in processing times for Async transcription

incident_updates.body:
We wanted to reach back out to share more detailed information on the incidents that occurred on 8/7 and 8/8. These incidents were caused by separate issues  See the information below for a description of each issue and the steps taken to remedy them.

8/7  
Incident Cause  
An inefficient database usage pattern change was submitted and deployed on 8/2. Although inefficient, due to the standard load prior to deployment, no regression was detected. We encountered a new peak load on 8/7 which along with this inefficiency led to a large increase in latency \(turnaround times\) which was the incident faced this day.

Resolution  
We identified and reverted the database usage change committed on 8/2 that led to this slowdown.  
We upgraded our database instance size.

8/8  
Incident Cause  
A full table query was run against our write replica database as a team worked to transfer data to BigQuery for business intelligence tooling. This led to database contention and slowed down our production service.

Resolution  
We implemented more fine-grained controls and roles for database access along with an approval process to verify production database queries are run against the correct replica and will not impact customers.

If you have any questions about this information feel free to reach out to [support@assemblyai.com](mailto:support@assemblyai.com).
Processing times have remained in the normal range and this incident is being transitioned to resolved.

Processing times for our Async endpoint have returned to the normal range and remained there for the last ~15 minutes. We will be monitoring traffic to ensure continued good performance going forward.
We are currently seeing an increase in processing times for our Async API. Our Engineering team is actively investigating the issue and we will post additional updates as we learn more.

We wanted to reach back out to share more detailed information on the incidents that occurred on 8/7 and 8/8. These incidents were caused by separate issues  See the information below for a description of each issue and the steps taken to remedy them.

8/7  
Incident Cause  
An inefficient database usage pattern change was submitted and deployed on 8/2. Although inefficient, due to the standard load prior to deployment, no regression was detected. We encountered a new peak load on 8/7 which along with this inefficiency led to a large increase in latency \(turnaround times\) which was the incident faced this day.

Resolution  
We identified and reverted the database usage change committed on 8/2 that led to this slowdown.  
We upgraded our database instance size.

8/8  
Incident Cause  
A full table query was run against our write replica database as a team worked to transfer data to BigQuery for business intelligence tooling. This led to database contention and slowed down our production service.

Resolution  
We implemented more fine-grained controls and roles for database access along with an approval process to verify production database queries are run against the correct replica and will not impact customers.  
  
If you have any questions about this information feel free to reach out to support@assemblyai.com.

Processing times have now returned to the normal range. We will continue to monitor traffic to ensure good performance going forward but at this point, this degradation of service is being marked as resolved.

We are continuing to monitor the situation but we are seeing processing times go down as a result of the latest changes we deployed. While we are not quite back to the normal processing range yet, we are moving in that direction. We will continue to monitor processing times and update you again once we have fully returned to the normal range.

The earlier changes we implemented did not improve processing times in the way that we hoped. We have another potential fix for this issue that we are working to release into Production. We will share another update here once that fix is live and we have had time to monitor its impact.
We have made some changes to address the slower-than-normal processing times we have been seeing and are currently monitoring the results of those changes to measure improvement.

We are still working to identify the root cause of the slowdown but it looks to be related to database load, which is causing degraded performance and slower-than-expected processing times. Jobs are still completing but with longer than normal turnaround times.

We have seen some improvement in processing times but we are still operating a higher than usual times. We are continuing to identify the root cause of the issue and will provide further updates as we learn more.

We are currently seeing slower-than-normal turnaround times for our Async API. Our Engineering team is actively investigating the issue and we will share additional information here as it becomes available.

incidents.name: Longer than usual processing time for our Async endpoint

incident_updates.body: We have continued to see traffic to our Async endpoint completing without issue and within the expected processing times range. All backlog jobs have completed and this slowdown is now being marked as resolved.

We have released an update to address the slowdown we were seeing in Async traffic and are now seeing improvements in transcripts completed and processing times. It may take a period of time for any jobs that were queued as a part of this slowdown to be completed but we are seeing processing times returning to the normal range for new traffic. We will continue to monitor traffic and will post another update once the slowdown has been fully resolved.

We have identified an issue that is affecting processing times for requests sent to our Async endpoint. Jobs are still completing without error but processing times are higher than usual. Our Engineering team is working to release an update to address this issue and we expect to see improvement soon. We will share further updates here as we work to resolve this issue.

Processing times have remained in the normal range since changes were made earlier to address the slowdown and all transcripts that were queued as a result of the slowdown have now been completed.

Our team is currently running a post-mortem on this issue so that we can work to eliminate the chances of this type of issue happening again in the future. That information will be added to this incident as soon as it is available.

Our Engineering team has made changes to address the slowdown in traffic we were seeing earlier. Traffic is once again processing as expected. Some requests were queued as a result of the earlier slowdown but those requests are now being processed as well and should complete successfully but with a longer than normal processing time. We will post another update once all of these queued jobs have completed.
We are having an issue in production causing transcripts to be throttled after implementing some infrastructure changes. Out team is working on a fix.

Processing times have returned to the normal range and we are no longer seeing a slowdown in traffic. We will continue to monitor turnaround times going forward but at this point the issues causing the slowdown have been resolved.

We have deployed a fix to address the slowdown and are seeing processing times go down as a result. We will continue to monitor the impact of this change and provide continued updates as we work towards returning to normal processing times.

We have identified the root cause of the slowdown which is due to workers failing to scale as expected. We are currently working to deploy a change that we believe will resolve the issue. We will provide further updates as we monitor the results of the change we are deploying.

We are currently investigating an issue that is leading to longer than expected processing times. This issue is not currently leading to failed transcripts but jobs will take longer than usual to complete, which in some cases could lead to throttling. Our Engineering team is currently working to identify and address the root cause of this issue and we will share further updates here as they become available.

incidents.name: Potential longer than usual processing times and intermittent website issues

incident_updates.body: AWS is reporting a recovery of the earlier issue. We will continue to monitor API and website health going forward but we do not expect any further impact from the earlier issues.

We are currently monitoring an AWS issue that has led to some intermittent degradation of service for our API and our website: https://health.aws.amazon.com/health/status

API traffic is currently working normally but this issue could lead to occasional increases in turnaround time. This issue is also affecting some aspects of our website including our Playground.
The issue with slower-than-usual processing times has been resolved.

We have deployed a fix for the slower-than-usual turnaround times and are seeing response times return to the normal range. We will continue to monitor the situation to ensure continued solid performance.

Our Engineering team has identified an issue within the punctuation portion of our pipeline. As a result, transcripts are still completing; however, at a slower-than-expected turnaround time.

We are working towards releasing a resolution and will provide updates accordingly.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We have identified the root cause as an issue with the latest AWS version of Boto3. We are working on a fix now and will have our systems back up in a few minutes.
Currently, our Async API is not accepting new requests. Our team is investigating this issue and working towards a solution.
This incident has been resolved.
Traffic is once again processing normally. Our team is monitoring the situation to ensure no further issues.
We are currently seeing slower than normal turnaround times for our Async API. Our team is investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We currently see degraded API performance; our team is investigating the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to work on a fix for this issue.
The root cause of this issue has been identified, and our team is working on a solution.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are currently investigating this issue.
This incident has been resolved, and traffic is processing normally.
A fix has been implemented, and we are actively monitoring performance as the API begins to process new transcripts.
We are currently seeing transcriptions for our async API remaining in a queued status for long periods of time. We have identified the root cause and are now working to fix the issue.
We are currently seeing slowed transcription for async API. We have identified the root cause and are currently fixing the issue.
